main.name: Emelia Jarnot
main.bio: I am a fullstack developer based in Portland, OR. I have fallen in love with coding and feel at home in its logic. I especially love problem solving within JavaScript. Both finding and squashing bugs and using the JavaScript language to answer and solve puzzles are things I especially enjoy!
main.contactmessage: Here is where you should write your message to readers to have them get in contact with you.

resume.skillmessage: Main experience in front end development within HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and React. I have some knowledge of backend REST APIs within Node.js, Express.js, and SQL. I also have a basic knowledge of working within Visual Studio Code, Github, and Postman

education.description: Spent time in an intensive, 9 week, course learning both the front end browser side of building websites, with HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and React; and in the backend building databases with SQL, and servers with Node and Express.

Studied sociology for 4 years at a small liberal arts college located in the Willamette Valley. Focused my senior thesis studies on postmodern theory and how it relates to our interactions and identities on social media.

work.title: Senior UX God

projects.title: Pokedex
projects.category: Search all original 151 Pokemon with this pokedex! Pokemon are searchable via Name, Type, and Weaknesses. Built as a project for a class, with original components

projects.title: Have You Seen this Cat?
projects.category: Memory game built using React and CSS. Built off a template that was originally a number guessing game.

projects.title: Giphy Search
projects.category: A search bar randomly generating gifs from Giphy by using its API key. This was an exercise in class to practice using fetch APIs and async await.

projects.title: Portfolio
projects.category: This portfolio website! Built using a template made with React. Added and edited both the CSS as well as the React components.
